comments:
Hi,
when opening run configurations I get the following stack after installing the latest tools via Calisto which prevents me from profiling:

eclipse.buildId=M20060921-0945
java.version=1.5.0_08
TPTP tools version: 4.1 -> 4.2 (there seems to be a mixture of feature versions)

I believe this is for Jerome.
Please target to 4.4 and review the priority according to http://www.eclipse.org/tptp/home/documents/process/development/bugzilla.html.
Would you please give more information about what you were trying to do? Did you try to create a launch configuration?

(In reply to comment #4)
> Would you please give more information about what you were trying to do? Did
> you try to create a launch configuration?

I had some run configurations to run unit tests. When i clicked on them I got the stack trace I attached.

Is there some further debugging I could do to hekp find the problem?
Did you get the exception when launching your configuration in Run mode or profile Mode?

(In reply to comment #6)
> Did you get the exception when launching your configuration in Run mode or
> profile Mode?

both. in fact not all the run configurations had this problem. I was able to click on some of them and they were fine. I couldn't work out what was common about those that worked and those that didn't.

Channing

I download Eclipse 3.2.1 build and run update manager to install TPTP and its dependencies project. Then I create a simple class, a simple Junit test, and run fine in both Run and Profile mode.

Is it possible to attach you workspace(in zip)? or try with the driver mentioned above?

(In reply to comment #8)
> Is it possible to attach you workspace(in zip)? or try with the driver
> mentioned above?

I'm afraid not - the client wouldn't like that.

I started with a clean workspace today and still had the problem after checking out the app. But I realised that some of the run targets I'm having trouble with are being shared in the project and checked in to CVS. I don't know if that would make any difference?

Channing

I tried your scenario again with the latest Callisto Update site and problem cannot be reproduced. 

Does this problem happens on Run and Debug mode, or just Profile mode?

(In reply to comment #10)
> I tried your scenario again with the latest Callisto Update site and problem
> cannot be reproduced. 
> 
> Does this problem happens on Run and Debug mode, or just Profile mode?
> 

Hi, I am also unable to reproduce the bug. To be honest  cannot remember which mode it occurred under but given we cannot reproduce it perhaps it doesn't matter.

Channing
Thanks for verifying the problem. Please reopen this Bugzilla entry if you see the problem happens again.
